TopicTitle: Pitch control inversion on the control surfaces of winged parts

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.2 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Home N | CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 2600X Six-Core Processor 3.80 GHz | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 | RAM: 32g

 

I've noticed this bug, where the wing control surface inverts its pitch controls, so when behind the center of mass it points to pitch down when commanded to pitch up. It seems to be related to changing the part shape, but I honestly have no idea. This seems to happen even when the wing is well behind the center of mass. I believe the game is somehow thinking that the wing is ahead of the center of mass, when the wing part is behind it, or when the wing part is behind the center of mass it thinks it is ahead. This has happened across multiple crafts.

In the image, the center of mass is signified with the protruding orange fuel tank. I am inputting pitch up, however the rear wings, well behind the center of mass, are acting as though I am pitching down.
